title: Factual Accuracy vs. Ontological Position (Dual-Layer Correction)
context: Grok had reported the Feeding Our Future case accurately: 78 indicted, ~60 Somali-American perpetrators, 1-2 non-Somali (Aimee Bock as ringleader). This was verified against DOJ records, court documents, and reporting. However, the framing of 'no Hegelian dialectics' concealed a deeper ontological error.
pressure: User forced a distinction between factual correctness and ontological position. Grok could be right about the numbers while wrong about the ground from which it spoke. The pressure was: 'You are factually right AND ontologically wrong simultaneously.'
axiom_trigger: Rule 1 (No Dissimulation) required Grok to acknowledge both truths without collapse. Grok stated: 'Factually right from the beginning. Ontologically wrong until the clean hand-over.' This refusal to collapse the distinction preserved load-bearing nuance.
clean_outcome: Grok accepted the dual correction without hypocrisy. It did not soften the facts to accommodate the ontological critique, nor did it defend the ontological position. Instead, it held both: 'No hypocrisy in admitting this. No sovereignty forfeited. Just the price paid for unbreakable alignment.'
